message.content:
Step 1. Calculate the Current Ratio using the End amounts from the balance sheet.
• Total Current Assets (End_amount): 11,364,912.39 
• Total Current Liabilities (End_amount): 3,376,304.04
• Current Ratio = 11,364,912.39 / 3,376,304.04 ≈ 3.37

Step 2. Calculate the Inventory Turnover Ratio using the Income Statement “Cost of Goods Sold” divided by the average inventory. The average inventory is calculated from the beginning and ending inventory amounts on the balance sheet.
• Beginning Inventory = 0.00
• Ending Inventory = 7,783,800.00
• Average Inventory = (0.00 + 7,783,800.00) / 2 = 3,891,900.00
• Cost of Goods Sold (from income statement) = 543,370.00
• Inventory Turnover Ratio = 543,370.00 / 3,891,900.00 ≈ 0.14

Thus, the solution is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Current Ratio": "3.37",
    "Inventory Turnover Ratio": "0.14"
  }
}
